author: raulj
content: Regarding: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/blob/medalla/book/src/validator-import-launchpad.md#1-run-the-lighthouse-account-validator-import-command are the passwords stored in plaintext in the filesystem?

author: raulj
content: we are following a similar approach and many people are surprised by this. We understand there are ways to protect that directory through permissions and other means, but just wondering if other teams have run into a similar conundrum

author: raulj
content: The alternative is to ask for manual input of every password for every keystore when the validator client starts up

author: raulj
content: which is not going to work if using systemd

author: ajsutton
content: In Teku we support loading the passwords via an unencrypted file or from an ENV var.  That fits in with a number of secrets providers make secrets accessible.  But we also support using eth2signer (http://github.com/PegaSysEng/eth2signer/) as an external signing service and it can load keys from various an HSM.  The ETH1 equivalent supports a bunch of cloud provider signing systems as well, not sure if that's made it over to the eth2 version yet.
